qas.question: What did a teacher of religion  from the college that was named after a Dominican friar do in 1839 of historical note ?

answers.text: published Esame Critico sulla dottrina dell’ Angelico Dottore S. Tommaso di Aquino circa il Peccato originale, relativamente alla Beatissima Vergine Maria

qas.question: Who was the teacher who committed the act  ?
What position was the teacher later given by the Holy Roman Church ?

answers.text: appoint Spada Master of the Sacred Palace in 1867

qas.question: Who gave the teacher the new job ?
What  problem did the teacher's publication solve for the Holy Roman leader with act that was committed  to do in response to the actions of the teacher  ?

answers.text: Pius IX was relieved of the problem of seeming to foster a doctrine not in agreement with the Aquinas' teaching.

plausible_answers.text: Esame Critico sulla dottrina dell’ Angelico Dottore S. Tommaso di Aquino circa il Peccato originale, relativamente alla Beatissima Vergine Maria

qas.question: What did Mariano Spada publish in 1872?
Who asserted that Aquinas was referring to the question of the immaculate conception?

plausible_answers.text: Esame Critico sulla dottrina dell’ Angelico Dottore S. Tommaso di Aquino circa il Peccato originale, relativamente alla Beatissima Vergine Maria

qas.question: What work asserted a problem between a doctrine of Pius IX and the teachings of Aquinas?
Who appointed Spada master of the sacred palace in the eighteenth century?

context: In 1839 <a1_0><b6_0>Mariano Spada<b6_0/><a1_0/> (1796 - 1872), professor of theology at the Roman College of Saint Thomas, <a0_0>published <b5_0><b7_0>Esame Critico sulla dottrina dell’ Angelico Dottore S. Tommaso di Aquino circa il Peccato originale, relativamente alla Beatissima Vergine Maria<b7_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> [A critical examination of the doctrine of St. Thomas Aquinas, the Angelic Doctor, regarding original sin with respect to the Most Blessed Virgin Mary], in which Aquinas is interpreted not as treating the question of the Immaculate Conception later formulated in the papal bull Ineffabilis Deus but rather the sanctification of the fetus within Mary's womb. Spada furnished an interpretation whereby <a4_0>Pius IX was relieved of the problem of seeming to foster a doctrine not in agreement with the Aquinas' teaching.<a4_0/> <a3_0><b8_0>Pope Pius IX<b8_0/><a3_0/> would later <a2_0>appoint Spada Master of the Sacred Palace in 1867<a2_0/>.
